body_content.explanation: limited, especially by official rules, laws, etc.:
examples: Building in this area of town is restricted.
Membership is restricted to (= it is only for) chief executive officers.
Our view of the stage was restricted (= objects prevented us from seeing the whole stage).

body_content.explanation: A restricted area is one that you need official permission to enter because the police or the armed forces want to keep it secret, or because it is considered dangerous:
examples: Wellington Barracks is a restricted area and anyone who enters should have identification.

body_content.explanation: A restricted document is one that you need official permission to read because the government wants to keep it secret.
